title: STRENGTH DECLARATION
description: INGREDIENTs of a GLOBAL PRODUCT may be SUBSTANCEs or SPECIFIED SUBSTANCEs.

maximumQuantity.title: maximumQuantity
maximumQuantity.description:
If the quantity of a PRODUCT INGREDIENT is defined as a quantity range, the Maximum quantity describes the upper end of such range. If the quantity of a PRODUCT INGREDIENT is defined via a maximum quantity, the Maximum quantity describes this maximum quantity (1).
If the quantity of the PRODUCT INGREDIENT is defined as an exact quantity, the Maximum quantity is not used (0).
If the quantity of the PRODUCT INGREDIENT is defined as an average quantity, the Maximum quantity may be used to describe the upper end of the quantity range (0...1).

maximumQuantityExponent.title: maximumQuantityExponent
maximumQuantityExponent.description: The Maximum Quantity may be described in a scientific number format, i.e. n x 10^m (n times 10 to the power of m). The Maximimum Quantity Exponent is the Exponent m.

maximumQuantityPotencyBase.title: maximumQuantityPotencyBase
maximumQuantityPotencyBase.description: The Maximum Quantity may be described in a scientific number format, i.e. n x 10^m (n times 10 to the power of m). The Maximimum Quantity Potency Base is the base 10.

minimumQuantity.title: minimumQuantity
minimumQuantity.description:
If the quantity of a PRODUCT INGREDIENT is defined as a quantity range, the Minimum quantity describes the lower end of such range. If the quantity of a PRODUCT INGREDIENT is defined via a minimal quantity, the Minimal quantity describes this minimal quantity (1).
If the quantity of the PRODUCT INGREDIENT is defined as an exact quantity, the Minimum quantity is not used (0).
If the quantity of the PRODUCT INGREDIENT is defined as an average quantity, the Mimimum quantity may be used to describe the lower end of the quantity range (0...1).

minimumQuantityExponent.title: minimumQuantityExponent
minimumQuantityExponent.description: The Minimum Quantity may be described in a scientific number format, i.e. n x 10^m (n times 10 to the power of m). The Minimum Quantity Exponent is the Exponent m.

minimumQuantityPotencyBase.title: minimumQuantityPotencyBase
minimumQuantityPotencyBase.description: The Minimum Quantity may be described in a scientific number format, i.e. n x 10^m (n times 10 to the power of m). The Minimum Quantity Potency Base is the base 10.

quantity.title: quantity
quantity.description:
If the quantity of a PRODUCT INGREDIENT is defined as an exact value, approximate value, or as an average value, the Quantity describes this value (1).
If the quantity of the PRODUCT INGREDIENT is defined as a range, the Maximum quantity and Minimum quantity describes this range (0).

quantityExponent.title: quantityExponent
quantityExponent.description: The Quantity may be described in a scientific number format, i.e. n x 10^m (n times 10 to the power of m). The Quantity Exponent is the Exponent m.

quantityPotencyBase.title: quantityPotencyBase
quantityPotencyBase.description: The Quantity may be described in a scientific number format, i.e. n x 10^m (n times 10 to the power of m). The Quantity Potency Base is the base 10.

sortKey.title: sortKey
sortKey.description:
The Sort Key is used to give the ACTIVE INGREDIENTs (AI) of a GLOBAL PRODUCT an order which must reflect the name of the GLOBAL PRODUCT.
The PRODUCT name includes the STRENGTH DECLARATION. The sequence of AI strengths is exactly defined and must no be changed.

concentrationTypeSapCode.title: concentrationType.sapCode
concentrationTypeSapCode.description: The SAP Code is the unique identifier from SAP to identity the data record.

concentrationTypeCode.title: concentrationType.sapCode
concentrationTypeCode.description: This field is decprecated and will be removed in the next version. Please use concentrationTypeSapCode instead.

concentrationTypeRefId.title: concentrationType.referenceDataId
concentrationTypeRefId.description: The Reference Data ID is the (technical) Identifier of all REFERNCE DATA maintained in the Reference Data Management System.

substanceId.title: substance.substanceId
substanceId.description: An ID with no business meaning

uomCode.title: uomForStrengthInformation.sapCode
uomCode.description: This field is decprecated and will be removed in the next version. Please use uomSapCode instead.

uomSapCode.title: uomForStrengthInformation.sapCode
uomSapCode.description: The unconverted Code in Column MSEHI of SAP table T006.

uomRefId.title: uomForStrengthInformation.referenceDataId
uomRefId.description: The Reference Data ID is the (technical) Identifier of all REFERNCE DATA maintained in the Reference Data Management System.

dailyDoseValue.title: dailyDose.dailyDoseValue
dailyDoseValue.description: The Daily Dose value is the numeric quantity of the assumed average maintenance dose of an active ingredient of a GLOBAL PRODUCT per day used for its main indication in human adults.

dailyDoseValueDisplay.title: dailyDose.valueDisplay
dailyDoseValueDisplay.description:
The Daily Dose value is the numeric quantity of the assumed average maintenance dose of an active ingredient of a GLOBAL PRODUCT per day used for its main indication in human adults.
same value as "value"; is used in MDG UI

dailyDoseNominatorUomSapCode.title: dailyDose.dailyDoseUomNumerator.sapCode
dailyDoseNominatorUomSapCode.description: The unconverted Code in Column MSEHI of SAP table T006.

dailyDoseNominatorUomRefId.title: dailyDoseUomNumerator.referenceDataId
dailyDoseNominatorUomRefId.description: The Reference Data ID is the (technical) Identifier of all REFERNCE DATA maintained in the Reference Data Management System.

isPlacebo.title: placebo
isPlacebo.description: The boolean operater Placebo indicates a Placebo. Only if the boolean operator is TRUE, a value of 0 for the STRENGTH DECLARATION is maintained.
